title: Windows automatic update seems to have made firefox unable to load most addons
content:
So my pc restarted overnight due to automatic windows updates, and it appears that from that point at midnight, to 10am PST, most of my firefox addons have stopped working/functioning all together.

Currently running the following: Alternate player for Twitch.tv BetterTTV Dark Reader Duckduckgo Privacy essentials facebook container privacy badger Reddit Enhancement Suite Ublock origin.

I've tried disabling all extensions and running them one at a time, with very little luck. None of them seem to function any more and clicking icons for the addons seems to just 'hang' on a loading page of sorts (See photo). Ublock options pictured in the second photo just hang on that setting page.

Thanks for any help
creator: kirbybrush

title: After months of no issues on new Desktop, Firefox will no longer open any web pages but other browsers will
content: I have uninstalled, done cleanup of orphan/widow files with CCleaner and Glary Utilizes, shut down and reinstalled Firefox with no success. No web pages can be opened. I have Windows 10.
creator: rickmbrown722

title: My account was hacked. Very weird. Lost bookmarks. I really need them back!
content:
My bookmarks have been lost. I think they're gone forever. I really needed them for work. A certain person hacked into my 1password account. I know it's "impossible" but not if someone knows you and is determined and smart. Anyway, he changed the email associated with my account, but not the password. I had to restore my computer. I downloaded Firefox and was logging in. I was prompted to enter the "original" email. Huh? I tried various ways to access my account using the email I knew was the right one to no avail. I had a recovery key, but no place to enter it. I was told I'd be sent an email. No.

A different email worked. But my bookmarks are gone. Any ideas on how i can recover them? I really need the bookmarks. And why would they disappear if the password wasn't changed?

I hope I missed something - like a created a second account without realizing it. Thanks for your help.
creator: stonyrun4e

title: Account hacked. Bookmarks gone. Disaster.
content: My bookmarks have been lost. I think they're gone forever. I really needed them for work. A certain person hacked into my 1password account. I know it's "impossible" but not if someone knows you and is determined and smart. Anyway, he changed the email associated with my account, but not the password. I was logging in, and was prompted to enter the "original" email. Huh? I tried various ways to access my account to no avail. I had a recovery key, but no place to enter it. A different email worked. But my bookmarks are gone. Any ideas on how i can recover them?

content: I used to sign in to GMAIL with no problems - email, password, done. Now I am always told that "This device is not recognized" and that Google wants to verify that it's me. So I type in the recovery email address, and I'm in. This started within the past week or two. I'm at a loss to figure out what changed, and I'd like to avoid having to type in the extra email address. This does not happen when I use the EDGE browser, only when I use Firefox, which is why I'm directing my question to Mozilla support. I tried playing around with the settings on Google, but the problem persists. Any suggestions?
creator: jfgallo48

title: every address timing out (google is the culprit)
content:
I have been having a bizarre problem for over a week. No matter what address I connect to (via a link or typing it in), down at the bottom of the browser I can see that a google.com address is stalled, not connecting, and preventing access to the connection - to the point of the connection timing out. My ISP is functioning properly.

I am not talking about links I click from a google search, but any and all pages I access.

In the first place there is no need for a google connection to be involved with the sites I am going to. And in the second place is there a way to prevent what I am guessing is google tracking, since it seems to the problem that is timing out all my browser activity.

Thirdly, I installed Chrome, also, to use a specific add-on for a project I work on. But the add-on did not do anything useful, so I uninstalled Chrome for that reason but also because there are clearly a lot of instances of telemetry that it does not appear possible to stop since Chrome does not seem to be configurable.

Of course there was a lot of Chrome junk that was not uninstalled. I was wondering if that could be causing the problem. So yesterday I made sure to get rid of as much of it as I could in the directory and the registry. But it has not made a difference.

I assume it is not a Firefox problem, since I use Cyberfox when a need a 32bit browers and have the same problem, though it is not as pronounced.

Any ideas about what is causing the problem and how I can put an end to it are welcome.

(I detest Windows 10 and how it dumbs down everything and prevents configuring, so continue to happily use Windows 7 (and XP too) with a stable 40MB ethernet connection. I am also using 8.8.8.8 DNS (googles) plugged into my modem so that Roku does a better job of connecting than if I use my ISP DNS.)

Mary G.

title: Bookmarks disappearing due to sync?
content:
Hei All,

I recently noticed that some of my bookmark folders have unfortunately been emptied.

I read related articles without finding any solution. So here are my questions:

- I am wondering if this might be due to a sync issue? I am mainly syncing between Windows 10 and iOS both on laptops. Once i turned on the sync on my smartphone, a Fairphone 3 with Android. But I turned off the sync and deleted all my browser data soon after. May this have caused a data loss?

- I've also recently tried out the multi-container add-on, but removed it again. Could this be the cause?

- Is there any limit in the amount of bookmarks one may save?

- And is it possible to restore ones bookmarks older than three weeks ago, from the cloud?

Thanks in advance for your help, still hoping to find those bookmarks back :)

Cheers, Tig

title: 81.0.2 FF64bit, it can't reach the extensions.update URL
content:
Hi, I started noticing my addons not needing updates, or I should say, not having updates, for 'awhile' so I started poking around. I clearly saw on several extensions, newer instances exist, but my FF installation, it told me there's nothing to update.

Then I came across this old/locked thread:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1271306#answer-1260814


but unlike there, I can't get my pc to load that page if I cut and pasted it into the browserURL. I even tested after closing out of my firewall, still no better. Wonder what else i can do, I'm assuming if I cant get there, FF can't check which addons have new additions.

When I go to the actual page of of an addon, there also isn't the option to update my addon from there, only the option to remove. It suggests then, I've got its newest version, which is false.

Only way to update my addins is, uninstall it and then reinstall it, it seems. Hoping not to do that for all my addons.

title: Firefox 82.0 (Restart Doesn't Update Client) 82.0.3 Update
content:
To you awesome people,

I've experienced this issue in several Windows 10 installations now, different builds, running 19042 currently, Home 64-bit.

My issue:

I can install Firefox without issues, configure it to my taste, no issues on that end.

I choose C:\Mozilla as my install directory.

However, whenever there's an update and I choose to download and install it, it downloads and installs fine, but when I need to restart the browser to apply the update, nothing has been updated.

As in this very instance, it was downloading and installing 82.0.3, but once restarted, Firefox is still stuck in 82.0.

I've not tampered with about:config just configured Firefox in the regular options.


What could be the cause?

Anyone else having these issues?

Thanks.

title: Firefox 82.02 some buttons and hypertext don't work
content:
Please advise,

I click on hypertext and/or a button. It fails. No response. No error message. It's as though I never clicked it. It's an intermittent problem that arises on many sites. The worst thing is it usually fails on an activation like making a payment, logging in, or joining a site. You know, right when you most need the button to work. Then I have to switch to Edge.

I suspect it has something to do with Java or Javascript not being functional with Firefox. However, the news of the workaround hasn't reached me. I've had Edge as my backup when this failure occurs. If Java is such a security threat, it doesn't make sense to have me switch to a browser that handles Java.
creator: free3ist

title: fishing planet online.
content:
Firstly,i am an emergency worker,i must regularly drop my mouse and run when the alarm rings. If i do this when playing Fishing Planet my game freezes if i am gone too long then i must use task manager to restart my pc.I know this is not your prob but it is the Devs of FP that are doing that because they dont like it if you leave your avatar hanging in game with no movement.Well i apologise to no one about having to do that because i am away busy dealing with peoples lives. 

  Now that all just describes FP tactics but where it concerns you is that FP is also refusing to allow me to pause the Sim and go to other web sites which i also need to do regularly. So basically if i pause FP and then browse to another site it keeps crashing my FF Browser as if they are trying not to allow me to do that while their sim is open. Well as i said i work strictly to an emergency alarm and FP has no right to crash my browser. Of course they will deny it but i assure you my assumptions are correct and they need to sync better with you. Thanks in advance,im sure there are other E staff all over the world getting punished by FP for leaving their Sim paused and it needs to be sorted out between them and you.

title: Windows Computer Doesn't Sync With Other Devices
content:
I have a computer running Windows 10, a recent iPhone, and a virtual machine running Arch Linux, all with the latest version of their Firefox installed and on the latest version of their OS, all logged into my Firefox account for Sync.

It looks like only my iOS and Linux instances of Firefox are syncing bookmarks and open tabs with each other, but my Windows machine just isn't sending or receiving Sync data. Sending pages directly to a device works, and so does syncing Firefox Extensions. Bookmarks and currently open tabs, however, do not sync between Windows and the other two instances. Everything did sync at one point about a week ago, but no bookmarks or tabs have been received from my Windows instance since.

So far I have attempted uninstalling/reinstalling Firefox on my phone, as well as logging out on all devices and logging back in starting with the desktop, but the issue is still there. Notifications are enabled on my phone and I haven't changed Sync settings on Desktop, so everything should be syncing. Thanks for any help.
creator: berg.gibson
